'''Charles E. Noad''' (1 September 1947-[[13 July]] [[2023]])<ref>[[Douglas A. Anderson]], ''[https://tolkienandfantasy.blogspot.com/2023/07/rip-charles-e-noad-1947-2023.html R.I.P. Charles E. Noad (1947-2023)]'' on tolkienandfantasy.blogspot.com (accessed 6 July 2023)</ref>  was a computer programmer, a proofreader and writer. He proofread [[The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien]], ''[[The History of Middle-earth]]'' series, and [[John D. Rateliff]]'s ''[[The History of The Hobbit]]''.<ref name=plaza>[http://web.archive.org/web/20100201112835/http://lotrplaza.com/forum/forum_posts.asp?TID=234548 Three Tolkien Book Reviews-Charles Noad] at the Internet Archive (accessed 6 July 2023)</ref>
==Quotes==
{{blockquote|"Charles Noad is a retired computer programmer and sometime proofreader. He read The Lord of the Rings in 1961 and has more or less stuck with it since.
 
There isn't really terribly much beyond that to say, really, and I doubt if the Plaza's good readers would want a detailed life of Noad in any case."<ref name=plaza />}} <small>Charles Noad in 2009, when asked to give biographical information on LOTRplaza.com </small>
